I DONT KNOW WHO NEEDS TO SEE THIS, BUT HERE IS SOME STRAIGHT FACTS/OPENIONS(NO OFFENCE)
WHAT I DAM LOVE ABOUT KDE
- the features they provide are just out of the box(the exact reason I use KDE daily)
WHAT I DAMN HATE ABOUT KDE(I know they are picky, and can theme out some of it, but native is always great)
- it looks straight out trash( mainly with respect to GNOME or XFCE)
- there is no uniformity in the UI
- the UI needs a lot of work, for example the icons in UI( compare with GNOME for example)

SO pleasssee we dont need to prioritize more on features wrt design and UI, Please make KDE look beautiful as much as it deserves!

KDE community I appreciate the work you did on this video and I don't know how you earn money from this but the video editing part is not good the animation is amazing but video editing can be improved a lot I will be happy to do it for you for free because I understand that you people don't get money because everybody uses Linux everybody uses the service but nobody pays or donates!

Please contact me here : productionnextlevel499@gmail.com
And I will help you for video editing part

This UI update looks freakin amazing.
I love everything about it!
If I could ask for something then it would be

- cleaner and more minimial side pane of file manager (left side that shows all drives, folders and stuff), there's too many things there.

- frosted glass / blue theme for light and dark theme, come on KDE, you can already do this, can you add a button in installation setup that asks users if they want more UI stuff? I know you have to worry about people with low end since you guys are well known for not consuming unnecessary resources, but if there is a prompt, it won't be a problem right?

- revamp discover UI, it does its job but the UI isn't very good for finding new apps or visually pleasing, if you are gonna do it some day, make it the sexiest appstore linux has to offer because you can do it, you guys are freakin talented.

- too many layers to small settings. That's really annoying when you are trying to theme KDE and theres so many settings that are like option within option within option within option then parameters. (This is something I believe is challenging since it requires redesigning settings hierarchy, but I believe KDE needs to do that, its lot of work for small changes (did I just complained on your behalf lol) )

Edit : just saw Gustavo part.
Respect for the guy 🥺❤️ F my man, may your rest in peace. Thank you for your contributions even though this message won't reach him...

It needs Breeze Theme Evolution implemented cause UI looks like 20 years old. Sometimes it seems that developers have some stupid fears that Breeze Theme Evolution will look similar to MacOS UI or Gnome and they do everything to make it looks completely opposite. Things like Latte dock must be shipped by default and all the other widgets (Window Title, Window Buttons) from Psifidotos (latte dock creator) cause it lets you have OSX style layout (even more functional actually). This way a user can choose which layout he prefers: OSX or Windows and KDE is all about the power of configuration and variety of options. Being minimalist is a GNOME thing.

Great! I'd like to suggest you to redesign also the Kde print menu. I noticed that it has really little option compared to eg. Gnome printing menu. From Okular you can't print while scaling the page (eg. print a page at 95% scale), or you can't "print to file" multiple page per sheet. I always need to open eg. Evince to do that. A redesigned print menu would be another great improvements for Kde apps!
